meanings.definition: To recognize or acknowledge the existence of something.
meanings.sent1: She was agnizing the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent2: He agnizes the importance of honesty.
meanings.sent3: The child agnized the presence of a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes agnized the truth in his words.
meanings.sent5: The detective agnized the clue that would solve the case.

meanings.definition: To feel deep mental anguish or remorse.
meanings.sent1: After the mistake, he was agnizing over his actions.
meanings.sent2: She agnizes every time she thinks about her lost pet.
meanings.sent3: The student agnized about failing the test.
meanings.sent4: His heart agnized with regret for not saying goodbye.
meanings.sent5: The old man agnized over the memories of his youth.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel deep mental anguish or remorse.
meanings.sent1: The news agnized her family members.
meanings.sent2: The harsh words agnized him deeply.
meanings.sent3: The movie agnized the audience with its tragic ending.
meanings.sent4: His betrayal agnized her beyond words.
meanings.sent5: The accident agnized the entire community.
